summary: The image displays a colorful pie chart with different slices representing various percentages of cells within a tissue sample. The chart is labeled as "The relative abundance of cell types in bone marrow." This suggests that the pie chart is used to illustrate the proportion of each cell type present in bone marrow, providing an overview of the diversity and composition of the cells found within this tissue.
corrected_text: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: Disturbances in hematopoiesis is a characteristic clinical finding in patients with AIDS. Patients present with abnormalities in one of more lineages resulting in neutropenia, anemia and thrombooytopenia, The mechanisms by which his causes these disturbances are not known but are critical 10 an understanding of the hematologic paleobiology of the vitus and the clinical management of patients with AIDS. In this grant, we propose to examine the molecular basis for our published findings of two mechanisms by which his can cause disturbances in hematopolesis: direct suppression of progenitor cell growth and differentiation; and a negative effect on the accessory hematopoiesis support function (HSF) of stoma ceils. Using a murine embryonic stem celt (ES) line, as a model for stem ceil development, and human stoma cell lines, transaction experiments will focus primarily on the role of the var regulatory gene in altering the developmental and functional properties of these hematopoiesis calls. This focus is based on the observation that var transected into a rhabdomyosarcoma cali line can induce its differentiation. Thus, var may cause disruption of the carefully regulated and coordinated processes of proliferation and differentiation that occurs during the development of progenitor cells into mature and functional progeny. A disruption in the function of stoma cells may similarly be affected by the activity of the var gene. In their paper on his induction of rhabdomyosarcoma muscle cell line differentiation, Levi and co- workers showed that his expression leads to inhibition of he muscle calls proliferation and the activation of the dormant endogenous differentiation program. The effect was mediated by the regulatory var gene of the virus with is protein acting as @ regulator of cell function. In discussing the implications of these findings. the authors speculate that stem cell populations (e9., skeletal muscle, cardiac muscle, hematopoletic pre- Cursors) ate disrupted by var and lose the ability to replenish tissues, leading to a gradual decline of mature effector population. Since some viruses can activate cellular genes in a variety of cells, it is reasonable to examine whether his regulatory genes can induce changes in the norma) pattern of gene expression in hematopoiesis progenitor cells and the accessory call function of stoma cells. Such an approach may provide evidence for the deregulation of proliferation and differentiation as a mechanism of bone marrow suppress: jon, The authors also postulate that cells that are subject to abortive infection, owing to an inability of the cells to support virus replication, nevertheless might be deregulated by the activities of vpe." Thus, non- productively infected cells of tissues that are not the usual targets of his in vivo, but are afflicted in AIDS palients, may be deregulated in the absence of reverse transcription, integration, or residual viral nucleic acid. This may explain the consistent lack of evidence for a direct effect on progenitor cells in in vive studies while in nitro experiments demonstrate that progenitor cells can be infected by his and their growth impaited. Though replication of the virus Is, Perhaps dogmatically, the yardstick by which a cell's opium for his is measured, it's possible that abortive infection of a cell that is not the usual target to the virus can Still alter the function of that cell. in this context, the marked suppression of progenitor cell growth In nitro following infection by hepatitis 8 virus correlates with only a ancient replication of the virus in bone marrow cultures. We postulate, therefore, that while bone marrow progenitor cells or stoma cells may not be the primary target cell of his in situ, abortive infection may still have negative consequences on their development and function. Our first aim is to determine whether the var gene of his is responsible for the suppression of hematopoiesis progenitor cells. The mouse embryonic stem cell (ES) Is a totipotential cell line that has the Capacity to develop into every tissue type when injected into host blastocysts. As such, i has become a valuable tool in the study of hematopoiesis and its molecular biotogy, and 80 will be used as a developmental model of hematopoiesis in these studles. Several characteristics of ES cells make it a good model to define the role of var (and other regulatory genes) in stem cell suppression, and a good substitute for primary bone Marrow derived GO84+ cells whose use in simitar studies may be technically more difficull, Since ES cells ate @ pure population of truly totipotential cells, they can be used to gain insight into the biological significance of novel genes, and dissect the molecular processes that occur during the early events of commitment, self-renewal, and differentiation of hematopoiesis progenitor sells. Furthermore, in villa techniques have been developed to. study hematopoiesis cell differentiation in ES ceils, and the profile and patter of genes activated during this process have been characterized and are consistent and reproducible. Thus, the expression of genes involved in the early stages of hematopoiesis precede those required for the terminal stages of differentiation. Alterations in the normal process of differentiation is reflected in a distorted profile of gene expression. These observations are relevant to the proposed study.
